intro: Monophyllaea sarangica, commonly known as the star flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
